title: How many square feet is 6 feet long by 8 feet wide? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hey 3rd grader! Have you learned how to multiply yet? Can you multiply 6 times 8? Or are you still at the adding stage. OK, that’s alright. Just add up 8+8+8+8+8+8. Or 6+6+6+6+6+6+6+6. When you get an answer, attach the letters “sq. ft.” at the end of the number.
48 sq. ft. Area of a rectangle = length * width length = 6 ft width = 8 ft Area = 6 ft * 8 ft Area = 48 ft²
